'''''Gymnopilus terrestris''''' is a species of [[mushroom]] in the [[Cortinariaceae]] family.

==Description==
The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] is {{convert|3|to|7|cm|in|1}} in diameter.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9">{{cite book |author=Hesler LR. |title=North American Species of ''Gymnopilus'' (Mycologia Memoir Series: No 3) |publisher=Lubrecht & Cramer Ltd |location=Knoxville, Tennessee |year=1969 |pages=34–35 |isbn=0-945345-39-9}}</ref>

== Distribution and habitat ==
''Gymnopilus terrestris'' grows on soil and humus, under [[conifer]]s. It has been found in Michigan, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Oregon, during June to October.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9"/>
